alert.note: Alert for Virginia Beach (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 23 at 4:04PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of the eastern City of Virginia Beach through 445 PM EDT... At 404 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 7 miles northeast of Virginia Beach. This storm was nearly stationary. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Virginia Beach, Oceana, Rudee Heights, Sigma, Sandbridge Beach, North Virginia Beach, Dam Neck and Macons Corner. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
